Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class GpuRenderTarget

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.core.RefCnt
icyllis.arc3d.engine.ManagedResource
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuRenderTarget
All Implemented Interfaces:
RefCounted, IGpuSurface, ISurface
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLRenderTarget
public abstract class GpuRenderTarget extends ManagedResource implements IGpuSurface
The GpuRenderTarget manages all objects used by a renderable primary surface, which are framebuffers, render passes and a set of attachments. This is the target of OpsRenderPass, and may be associated with Surface.

A GpuRenderTarget is always associated with a renderable primary surface, which can be either a renderable GpuTexture or a wrapped BackendRenderTarget. This class is used by the pipeline internally. Use RenderTextureProxy and RenderTargetProxy for high-level operations.

  • Field Details

    • mStencilBuffer

      @SharedPtr protected Attachment mStencilBuffer
      The stencil buffer is set at first only with wrapped GLRenderTarget, the stencil attachment is fake and made beforehand (renderbuffer id 0). For example, wrapping OpenGL default framebuffer (framebuffer id 0).

      Description copied from interface: IGpuSurface

      If this object is texture, returns the associated framebuffer if renderable, otherwise null.

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • getSurfaceFlags

      public int getSurfaceFlags()
      Description copied from interface: IGpuSurface
      Surface flags.
      • ISurface.FLAG_BUDGETED - Indicates whether an allocation should count against a cache budget. Budgeted when set, otherwise not budgeted. GpuTexture or RenderTexture only.
      • ISurface.FLAG_MIPMAPPED - Used to say whether a texture has mip levels allocated or not. Mipmaps are allocated when set, otherwise mipmaps are not allocated. GpuTexture or RenderTexture only.
      • ISurface.FLAG_RENDERABLE - Used to say whether a surface can be rendered to, whether a texture can be used as color attachments. Renderable when set, otherwise not renderable.
      • ISurface.FLAG_PROTECTED - Used to say whether texture is backed by protected memory. Protected when set, otherwise not protected.
      • ISurface.FLAG_READ_ONLY - Means the pixels in the texture are read-only. Non-renderable GpuTexture only.
      Specified by:
      getSurfaceFlags in interface IGpuSurface
      Returns:
      combination of the above flags

    • attachStencilBuffer

      protected abstract void attachStencilBuffer(@SharedPtr Attachment stencilBuffer)
      Allows the backends to perform any additional work that is required for attaching an Attachment. When this is called, the Attachment has already been put onto the RenderTarget. This method must return false if any failures occur when completing the stencil attachment.
      See Also:
      • ResourceProvider
